AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH------- 
ESSE JOGO É AWESOME!!!

Bom, antes de falar das coisas boas desse jogo e uma ruim, sim, só tem uma coisa ruim nesse jogo, não se se aconteceu só comigo, mas enfim, Noitu Love 2 foi anunciado em abril de 2010 por Konjak, pra quem conheceu ele por causa de Noitu Love 2 daqui da steam, saiba que ele tem o seu proprio site, onde desenvolve jogos e deixa a demo ou beta deles para o povo jogar.

Noitu Love 2 estava recebendo um porto Wii em colaboração com o Golgoth Studio, mas depois disso nada foi anunciado, alem de não ter mais noticias da Golgoth Studio desde 4 de junho de 2011, alem do jogo esta disponivel aqui, na steam, desde abril de 2012.

O jogo se passa no ano de 2288. A cidade é protegida por uma organização chamada "The Peacekeepers League" e tudo é incessante exceto por isso estar sob ataque! Por um exército de robôs liderado pelo darn do professor Darnacus, resumindo, um doutor maluco com um exercito de robos que foder com o mundo, como sempre. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

100 Anos depois dos acontecimentos do Noitu Love 1, a nova estrela da organização é XodaRap, uma coisa legal que o Konjak fez, se você inverter Noitu Love e XodaRap, fica Evolution e Paradox, enfim, voltando, XodaRap tem que infrentar o exercito do doutor maluco que tinha voltado a vida.

Noitu Love 2 é um jogo que possui muitos pontos positivos,um deles são os graficos, que são leves mas mesmo assim bonitos, deixando o jogo muito leve, pra um jogo que foi feito por apenas uma pessoa, ele é muito bom, sprites muito bem feitos, deixando a animação fluida e linda.

Agora vamos para a melhor parte desse jogo, os controles, mano, oque eu posso falar dos controles desse jogo, W A S e D, são usados para se movimentar, sendo que W faz você pular, coisa que quase todo o jogo usa, ou as setinhas que são uma segunda opção, porque estou falando dos controles? você se pergunta, se você é uma pessoa que nunca jogou o primeiro jogo, os controles dele eram, Control bate, e o Shift PULA, tipo, QUEM DIABOS USA O SHIFT PRA PULAR? enfim. voltando ao segundo jogo, você usa o botão esquerdo do mouse pra pular, Oh yeah.

Interessante que você tem uma mira que é controlada pelo mouse, que se você mira no oponente e aperta , você da um dash ate ele, ou para socalo, ou para seguralo e jogalo em outros oponente, ah, e se você concentrar o soco você atira uma bola de energia, ah, e se você apertar o botão direito você cria meio que um escudo contra progeteis, que é essencial para vencer alguns chefes, e apertando o botão de andar e pular você da uns ataques diferentes, alem de você poder andar abaixado, a jogabilidade desse jogo é muito boa e precisa, não atrapalhando nada na hora de você jogar.

Esse jogo tem poucas fases, mas cada uma deles são unicas, vou falar apenas 3 delas aqui, a primeira é bem simples, é só meter a porrada em todo mundo, a segunda tem zumbis, a terceira ta mais pra tipo... uma fase plataforma, agora falando das musicas desse jogo, que cara, são muito boas, e cada fase tem sua musica unica e muito boas, esse jogo não tem nenhum tipo de Power Up, mas realmente não precisa.


Esse jogo é incrivel, apesar de ser pago vale cada sentavo, (apesar que um amigo meu deu) graficos lindos, colorido, musica boa, jogabilidade incrivel e rapida pra caramba, alem de ter um Fator Repley loco, você pode zerar esse jogo 3 vezes com outros personagens, é um jogo bom pra você jogar quando não esta fazendo nada.

Noitu Love 2: Devolution é um jogo incrivel. Tem uma jogabilidade rápida e extremamente precisa, tão rápido que as vezes eu até fiquei confuso sobre minha posição no campo da tela.
É um jogo com gráficos pixelados mas muito bonito, e as animações dos sprigts(eu acho que se escreve assim) são de cair o queixo!
Uma história boa e com um ótimo desenrolar e uma reviravolta surpriendente!
A trilha sonora é no estilo 16-Bits, mas, é muito bem encaixada com cada fase e ambiente de chefes, o que deixa o clima do jogo muito épico e as vezes até dando a empressão de estar jogando um clássico da era 16-Bits.
A dificuldade do jogo é mediana em minha opinião, porém no modo mais dificil, partes que seriam de dificuldade média ou fácil pode ficar beeem dificil!
O jogo infelizmente tem alguns bugs do tipo, um inimigo parado, você ficar preso na borda da tela ou até ser teleportado para o nada. Mas felizmente esses são bem ocasionais.
Eu recomendo esse jogo para qualquer um que quiser uma experiência rápida e frenética!!

30429153.review:
This is a fun little game that takes its cues from classic Treasure action games for the Genesis (Gunstar Heroes, Alien Soldier, etc.). Here's the thing, though: while Noitu Love 2 is inspired by those games, it does not play like them at *all*. Firstly, Treasure games are known for their flawless action game controls. This game, on the other hand, is a bit clunky to handle. You use WASD at get around and the mouse to attack...there's no controller support, which is just odd when you consider that the game is inspired by console titles. The mouse attacks don't always work that well, and sometimes it feels like you're just clicking as fast as you can and hoping that it's doing something. Secondly, Treasure games are known for their gameplay variety. Noitu Love 2 mostly just has you racing through short, linear stages, clicking the left mouse button as fast as as you can. You don't get techniques or skills as you progress: you simply click, click, click, and click some more. There's a stage where you fly around with a special beam weapon, but it's not different enough to break up the repetition of the rest of the game. 

If all that is true, why am I recommending this? I'm making it sound like it isn't a very good game, right? Well, despite Noitu Love 2's drawbacks, it's still pretty cool. I bought the game for about a dollar when it was on sale, and I feel like it was money well-spent. It's a great diversion if you're burnt out on open world epics and you just want to kick back and have a retro-style action experience. There are a lot of cool, creative bosses (the TV camera boss was my favorite), the music is solid, and the art direction is awesome. All the sprites look great and they have so much personality and character. The story is nonsense, but that just adds to the frenetic, funny spirit of the game. You've also got some decent replay value here; you can unlock new characters with their own playstyle, which lets you mix things up a bit (one of the new characters is *very* different, but I won't spoil it for you), and you can try out the game on harder difficulty settings, do high score runs, etc.

So yes, it's a mindless, slightly janky mouse click simulator, but it's a *fun* mindless, slightly janky mouse click simulator. It's basically a Flash game on steroids, but it's a *fun* Flash game on steroids. I was blown away when I realized that Noitu Love 2 was almost entirely the product of one person...the gameplay itself might be quite simple, but the thought and effort that went into the game's style is truly impressive. If you have any affection for 16-bit action games, Noitu Love 2 will make you smile. Just don't go in expecting something on the level of Treasure classics and you'll be satisfied.

Oh, and one more thing: the game is short. You can easily breeze through the entire thing in one session on the normal difficulty level. But, as I mentioned, there are some nice replay possibilities, and short length of the game doesn't make it any less fun.

30133270.review:
Noitu Love 2: Devolution is a short and sweet sequel to an older platforming game featuring a new movement and attack system that incorporates a mouse-controlled targeting reticle and keyboard keys. Compared to its predecessor, NL2 is a faster and busier game with enemies practically flooding the screen at times, their attacks ceasing only when you manage to progress to the next checkpoint. 

Every stage manages to have its own theme and gimmick such as chaining beam attacks or inverting gravity and you get to “practice” with each theme versus enemies and mini-bosses before fighting the stage boss, who typically uses a combination of the things you learned earlier. This makes for a very smooth learning curve that even a novice gamer will be able to pick up on quickly.

Sadly, the one thing lacking in this otherwise perfect gem is length. Since many of the stages encourage you to rush forward, it’s very easy to end up breezing through this title in less than 90 minutes. It’s still a really fun 90 minutes though, and a great deal for such a low price.

Conheci o game em 2012 por um canal chamado Colônia Contra Ataca, ele gravou com o titulo "Jogos Bons que Você Não Conhece", o titulo dizia a verdade, o jogo é ótimo. Rapído, com um sistema de batalha ótimo, que varia de cada um dos 3 personagens disponiveis, Xoda, a 1° personagem, o seu sistema é simples, você clica para atacar o inimigo, aperta para se mover 2 vezes e você da um dash, entre outras coisas, não falarei dos outros personagens, descubram sozinhos! :D

Os bosses são INCRÍVEIS, quando eu digo INCRÍVEIS,  cada um com seu próprio jeito de morrer, meu favorito é o Musico Joy, que você aperta no piano para cair um machado em cima dele. Outro bem legal é um em que ele te ataca usando canais de televisão.

A historia do jogo é muito boa, cada personagem tem sua história, motivos e bosses, por exemplo, quando você joga com a Xoda, tem uma fase que você enfrenta a Rilo, quando você está jogando com a Rilo, você enfrenta a Xoda nesta mesma fase, além de vários outros. E o Plot Twist no final é surpreendente, acho que ninguém esperaria por essa. Além do mais, eu e digo, se você gosta de Jogos 2D, ação, musicas boas, história, rapidez e muito mais, este jogo é perfeito para você.

11/10

24168351.review:
A short, yet powerful little game. It keeps you interested during its entire duration. Things never get boring, since you are constantly getting new content during the entire game. There is no grind, no padding, just action. Not to say that the game doesn't tone it down a little once in a while, it masterfully keeps the interest curve well balanced. You won't get fatigued by too much action too long, yet at the same time there is no risk of getting bored. Some parts may be simple traversal, but even then you are assaulted by enemies just often enough not to feel safe.

The art and music are excellent too, the soundtrack could easily have been sold as an extra, but instead it's downloadable free of charge. As for the art, it has an unique style that fits the game and is easy to read, yet never gets monotonous.

The story isn't anything special. It has a twist or two, but if you are playing a game like this for the story then you are doing it wrong. It's a fair excuse to have an awesome time and nothing more.

The difficulty is just right.

Overall, if the trailer video didn't instantly win you over then there is no point in trying the game, you just don't "get" it.

14385035.review:
If you ever dreamed of an action-arcade game where LMB is pretty much the only control, you might enjoy this game. The enemies, bosses, and how they interact with the environment are really the highlights of the gameplay. However, one minor setback is that there's no "Restart level" option, which is something that has become expected in similar arcade-based games.

I wouldn't say the bosses are Nintendo-hard, but they are pattern-based, which can be a bit of a jump from the button-mashing that the game establishes. The game basically forces you to restart from checkpoint when you die, so even if you were doing well in a level and get whooped by the boss (which isn't always easy to predict), you'll still end up with a D grade. It's like taking a course where all the assignments are straightforward, and suddenly the instructor gives you a pop quiz with totally new material worth 50% of your grade.

Apart from this minor complaint, there is little else wrong with the game. I would recommend it for everything it does right -- the simple cathartic pleasure of beating things up, the music, graphics, and the style-over-substance story (which actually works in a game like this). If you enjoyed the demo, then you wouldn't be doing yourself a disservice to pick this one up.

14074303.review:
[b]Вердикт[/b]
Ищите хороший платформер? Тогда вы явно не по адресу.
Объективная оценка - 29 / 100
Субъективная оценка - полный шлак

[b]Игровой интерес[/b]
В сюжетном плане - невнятная история про покоривших мир роботов и мальчика, который раздаёт им люлей, вызывает лишь раздражение и желание промотать ролики.
Сам геймплей - линейный забег с толпами постоянно спавнящихся врагов. Убивать их нет никакого резона, всё-равно возрождаются бесчисленными толпами. Пробежал, перепрыгнул, побежал дальше. Никаких секретов, тайников, оружия, прокачки. Герой обучен лишь паре спецударов, от которых всё-равно никакого толка. Геймплей сводится к бесцельному спонтанному заклацыванию врагов. Так как их катастрофически много, то каждый удар достигает цели. Никакой стратегии - просто клац-клац-клац...
Интерес представляют лишь боссы и мини-боссы, коих тут предостаточно. Некоторые просто заклацываются, некоторые требует определённого подхода, хотя существенной сложности они не представляют - просто вносят хоть какое-то разнообразие в скучный процесс.

[b]Графика и дизайн[/b]
Пиксельная графика яркая и аккуратная.
Но дизайн можно охарактеризовать одним слово "никакой". Бэкграунды разнообразные, но ничем не примечательные. В качестве врагов выступают роботы во всех проявлениях - простые роботы, одноглазые, нинзя, летающие, роботы-осьминоги... и сюда же для разнообразия приплели смерть с косой... Оригинально? Нет. Если от полнейшего беспредела, творящегося на экране в Metal Slug, пробирало до слёз, то тутошний хаос вызывает недоумение - не стильно, не смешно. Нет изюминки, всё выглядит очень пресно.

[b]Музыка[/b]
Тынц-тынц-тынц-тынц-тынц-тынц-тынц-выкл.
Ухи такое долго не вытерпят.

[b]Реализация[/b]
В техническом плане - плохо. Очень плохо.
Оконный режим без возможности переключиться в полный экран, без возможности свернуть окно, передвинуть или убрать на второй план (да, галочка в опциях есть, но ведь она не работает).
Про существование геймпада авторы игры не слыхали, а клавиатура+мышь для акрад равноценны верёвке+мылу. К тому же управление зачастую неотзывчивое, плохо реагирует на двойные нажатия, и игра сводится к хаотичным нажатиям в расчёте, что удар будет нанесён, благо врагов вокруг полно.
Программных багов тоже полно. После выхода из спящего режима управление вообще реагировало через нажатие. Настройки вызываются отдельным окном, и переназначить их из игры нельзя. Оверлея нет, скриншоты не снять... А как вам полное зависание на битве с боссом в конце уровня? Сильно захочется после этого опять играть?

Хороших аркад много, очень много. Так что не стоит тратить время на эту бездушную поделку.

13863010.review:
Noitu Love 2 Devolution is a retro side-scroller beat-em-up game with Metal Slug-esque graphics. Unfortunately, the game is both incredibly simple and incredibly easy, and not worth your time.

Story

	The game’s story makes no sense; it involves some bizarre time-travel plot which isn’t really time travel… it doesn’t really make any sense, but it doesn’t need to and really isn’t supposed to.

Gameplay

	The gameplay is very simple and is at the heart of the game, but unfortunately is also terrible. You control an on-screen reticle with your mouse, and by clicking, you attack to that spot, if there is an enemy highlighted. You can also hold down your mouse button for a charge shot, jump, move side-to-side, or do a dash attack or spinning jump attack. In the end, while these attacks are theoretically meaningful, most of the time you’re just running to the right, frequently using dash attacks to get through the stages faster to fight the bosses… where, mostly, you just wait to do your thing, or sometimes just straight up attack them as fast as possible, depending on the boss. Many of the bosses don’t require any strategy, while others require a little strategy but not very much.
	Ultimately the gameplay is very unsatisfying, and there is very little “meat” to it – the game requires very little strategy and very large amounts of mindless clicking. There is some enemy variety, but most of it is fairly meaningless as strategy has little meaning with the game’s control scheme, and most of the ordinary enemies are both trivial and easily bypassed. Even the bosses mostly are not very interesting, with only a very small number requiring any sort of real strategy. On the whole, the game feels far too simple and straightforward, like you are only there to click to attack a large number of times.

Graphics

	The game does a fine job of emulating the era it is trying to emulate; it isn’t particularly beautiful, but it isn’t ugly either, and it is significantly better than a lot of the 8-bit pseudo-retro graphics indie games floating around the market.

Final Summary

	Noitu Love 2 Devolution is not worth your money, but more importantly, it isn’t worth your time. You will derive more satisfaction out of doing most anything else.

12992601.review: Do you like Mischief Makers? Do you like Gunstar Heroes? Do you like Alien Soldier? Do you happen to enjoy highly-rasterized cult classics with fast movement and faster combat (Treasure games)? If you answered yes to any or all of these questions, then pick up Noitu Love 2. Each one of your punches and kicks resonates with that distinctive crunch and pop that calls pixel art games home, while an unrelenting lo-fi keyboard soundtrack and and screen-filling explosions whenever anything blows up (there's hardly a moment where something isn't blowing up) seal the aesthetic deal. It's very satisfying when all's said and done. Good game for speedrunning if you're into that, too, since the entire game is built on that very concept.

12726140.review:
Noitu Love 2 est un jeu qui allie plateforme et Beat 'Em Up, dans une ambiance déjantée extremement plaisante. Les graphismes old-school sont vraiment réussis, très colorés et détaillés. 
Chaque personnage possède un gameplay différent ce qui offre une rejouabilité au soft, et donc une durée de vie allongée. 
On pourra noter quelques légères influences issus de vieux jeux tels que Megaman X (ennemis robotiques, boss en fin de stage) ou Metal Slug (au niveau des paysages différents pour chaque stage, la nervosité des controles, le scénario simple mais efficace, le style arcade, etc ...). 
Les musiques sont rythmées, fun et collent bien avec l'ensemble. Une difficulté croissante qui donnera du plaisir à jouer aux néophytes comme aux joueurs avertis.
Seul bémol : je n'ai pas réussi à faire fonctionner le jeu avec une manette. La jouabilité au clavier est certes bonne, mais je pense qu'elle serait beaucoup plus intuitive et fluide avec une manette.
En bref, un jeu très cohérent à tous les niveaux, du contenu non négligeable même si on peut le qualifier de "petit jeu" : personnages déblocables, stages et boss secrets, ...) et qui vous occupera donc pendant quelques heures, ou une dizaine d'heure si vous voulez obtenir le rang maximum dans chaque stage.

11517366.review:
This is a fun game. I'm bad at giving things numeric ratings, so I'll just go over my thoughts on the most likely reason people wouldn't want to buy this game. For the most part they're pulled from the negative reviews (which are all relatively ostracized and 'unhelpful', suggesting these people are in the vast minority. Then again, that's also because a lot of them are quite ineloquent).

So without further ado, things people may gripe about related to buying/playing this game:

"The game is too short"
It took me about 1.5 hours to beat the game without caring about taking damage or getting a good score on normal. If you don't care about beating it on hard or if your motto is 'D stands for Diploma' then chances are you may think the game is 'too short' although I'd argue that it's still a better time/money ratio than going to a movie.

"All you do is click on things"
This is something of a 2D-action beat-em-up where you jump around, enemies show up, and sometimes (but not always) you have to kill a certain number of enemies before being able to scroll the screen. A key mechanic is that, if you're hovering over an enemy, clicking the mouse will jump/drag/move your character to the enemy. That in combination with the fact that rapid-clicking will result in pretty quick basic attacks that will destroy most normal enemies.

This is not to say that you still don't have to move left and right. Add to that the fact that ducking is also required on more than one occasion, means that anyone who says 'all you have to do is click on things' is clearly exagerating, which is one of the reasons why no-one likes them (er, 'finds them helpful'). 

In reality, you have 4 keys for move/jump/duck and can perform special moves by double clicking up/left/right or holding the right mouse button and swiping. Aside from further invalidating the afforementioned argument, this also provides a fun way to move faster than walking/jumping speed, which is always welcomed.

Basically, yes, on normal you COULD beat MOST of the game with only the right arrow and the left mouse button, but I wouldn't recommend it. If you're never using specials then, well, I don't know why you would do that.

"It's too easy"
*shrug* I'll admit, I didn't die that much on normal and I didn't spend too much time paying attention to boss patterns or trying to avoid hits or etc. That being said, I did die a few times and I got the lowest letter ranking on every level. Getting an A (I assume? maybe higher?) rank would, probably, take at least some effort to achieve. Also, I tried to play level 1 with the same carefree attitude on hard and managed to die without too much trouble, but I probably wouldn't have if I would have been taking it slower.

"It's boring"
Watch the trailer. That's the game. If you think that's boring then don't buy the game. Not every game is for everyone, but I seriously don't understand this argument once you see what you're getting yourself in to.

"The art style is [insert criticism]"
*Shrug* I think it's fine, but my first system was a Genesis so I'm no stranger to pixels. I think the art in the game is great, but I wasn't playing full screen. Really though, just see the above comment and replace 'that's boring' with 'that represents a sub-par art-style' and I think we're good.

"Rawr I made a complaint about the game and you didn't include mine, I hate you"
Um... my bad, maybe your complaint should be more logical ;-). If you think your complaint is logical, please just leave a comment or, y'know, don't bother me and go away :-D.

11501512.review:
Mais avec tout ça, je n’ai pas encore parlé du gameplay du jeu qui le rend si bon. Le jeu est nerveux comme pas possible, ce qui le rend aussi jouissif que Vanquish l’est pour cette même raison, dans un autre genre. Ce côté extrêmement rapide du jeu est en effet un de ses plus gros points forts, tant ça apporte une bouffée d’air frais et que ça pose toutes les bases du gameplay. Pour ne pas être gêné en pleine course mais aussi comme tout excellent jeu 2D qui se respecte (tel que le récent Rayman Origins), Noitu Love 2 possède du walljump, ce mouvement génial qui permet de rebondir en sautant de mur en mur. Mais aussi, plus original, vous pouvez faire un saut qui vous accrochera à une plateforme en l’air ou encore pour directement attraper un ennemi, ce qui est tout aussi nerveux et pratique. Tout dans les mouvements et possibilités de votre personnage est fait pour que vous puissiez foncer à toute vitesse en explosant le plus d’ennemis possible sur votre passage. Mais pour ne pas trop prendre de dégâts, vous disposez aussi d’un bouclier qui, en plus d’arrêter les petits projectiles, peut vous protéger de certains dangers du level design ou vous permettre de passer un endroit du jeu. Car oui, le level design est un autre des gros points forts du jeu. Celui-ci est toujours au top et, à travers les sept différents niveaux du jeu, il ne cesse de se renouveler et de surprendre. Si un des niveaux est plutôt classique et traditionnel (le niveau sous-marin, que l’on retrouve dans tout jeu de plateforme ou d’action 2D), il reste maîtrisé avec une nervosité qui est handicapée par le fait que le personnage se trouve sous l’eau, tout en restant dans la veine du reste. D’autres proposent même de jouer à un autre style de jeu, un des niveaux étant une sorte de shoot’em up sur tourelle, restant néanmoins plutôt original avec des ennemis extrêmement bien pensés. Ainsi, le jeu n’est jamais répétitif et toujours jouissif.

10244897.review:
If ever there were a love letter written to 1990's era Treasure, Noitu Love 2 is it. Frantic, fast, furious, and fun. It can take a bit to come to grips with the unique control scheme, but once you've spent some time in the tutorial and gotten mastery of a few stages under your belt, you'll be up to speed and zip around the screen causing all manners of chaos. 

The game features an incredible amount of variety packed into its arcade length. There's no shortage of stage gimmicks and unique fodder enemies to pound away on, and how could you forget the positively over-the-top boss encounters, which will push your dexterity to the limit and require a good bit of thought to truly best. 

Noitu Love's difficulty is also balanced very well. Each of the game's difficulties suits a range of player skill levels, and advancing to a higher difficulty level doesn't only make enemies hit harder, they also have a few new tricks up their sleeve which keep things fresh and interesting. It's far from punishing like a lot of 2D platformers and action games these days tend to be, but you will be tested and failure only leads to more learning. 

Add a couple unlockable playable characters with some fun stage variations between them on top and you've got an amazingly solid little package just eager for lovers of frantic old-school games to take hold of and enjoy.

9824692.review:
Noitu Love 2: Devolution is an absolutely smashing (pun-intended) hidden action/indie gem. It features some fantastic mouse controlled gameplay with tons of robots to smash up and plenty of firepower to do so. To be blunt, every single bit of this game is absolutely fabulous.... the boss battles are challenging but fair, the pixel-art style is gorgeous, the level design is awesome, and the music... is great!

Really, what better could you possibly ask for out of a $5 game? Granted, it's not all that long with the base story, but I found myself completing the game many times with the variety of unlockable characters available to you and the multiple difficulty settings. Too easy? That's okay, the game is more than happy to crank up the difficulty for you... no matter how experienced you are, there's always something fun and challenging for you here. Beat your previous score on the levels, shoot for an A ranking, or even just something as self-imposed as trying to go through the game without taking any damage. 

For those few saying the combat is "Boring"... did you even go through the OPTIONAL tutorial available to you? There's many different attacks you can use, not just the simple punching up an enemy to bits one... (although even that is great fun) and the other two characters you unlock after beating the game in various ways each feature their own unique attack and movement styles... it's all great fun, so you really need to give it another go.

To anybody debating about purchasing this game, just go ahead and do it! It's well worth the money, one of the best games you could buy at this pricepoint.

As for me... I'm just hoping they make another sequel! :D

Маленький 2D-шедевр. Перед ваши экшен-слешер с пикспельной графиков в 2D, так сказать возвращение в олдскул. Честно по началу (а в некоторые моменты очень-очень) напоминает Contra: Hard Corp, но это можно назвать и плюсом, игра то достойная. Боевка довольно интересная, но простоя и завязана на клаве (движение и прыжки) и мышке (удар, щит и супер-прием). 
В игре 3 играбельных персонажа, причем геймплей за них разительно отличается. Сначала мы играем за девушку по имени Xoda, за нее основная и самая продолжительная компания. Игра за нее представляет за себя слешер, деретесь в рукопашку и прыгаете по всему экрану раздавая тумаки врагам и огромным боссам. Далее откроют киборга Rilo, за нее уже идет та самая Contra. Вы вооружены пушкой и мечом. И последний герой (открывается после Rilo) это Almond. Тут игра превращается вообще в тир, разве что вам придется уклонятся самим героем и перетаскивать его по экрану (прыгает он как обычный человек). При всем разнообразии геймплеев уровни одни и те же и это довольно интересно смотрится. Разница только в нескольких боссах.
Ну и сюжет. Он тут есть, неплохой, с неожиданным поворотом и расматривается за всех трех персонажей складывая их в одну мозайку. Но даже если не вникать в сюжет, вы получите отличный экшен
И немного о боссах. Жалко, что нельзя делать скриншоты, потому что некоторые боссы так и хочется запечатлить. Как и сами уровни, их главари разнообразны и иногда заставляют задуматься, как же их победить? Я например на одном уровне только с 3 попытки понял как бить супостата и такое было не раз. Ах да, тут есть один секретный босс ;)

8672142.review: Noitu Love 2: Devolution is short and sweet, like many of my favorite games. The length is just right to finish it in one session, and come away feeling satisfied. The combat flows extremely smoothly, and while the amount of things going on the screen might be a bit overwhelming to some, with a bit of practice, figuring out what to do becomes a matter of picking up on signals. The pixel style and colors of the game complement each other greatly, leaving behind fun atmospheres that are easily differentiated and nice to look at. The characters are all unique, and their personality is shown despite their simplicity. The pace of the game may leave you wanting to see stills of certain scenes, as things happen so quickly. If you enjoy short games with a basic plot, but wonderful game-play and scenery to back it up, I'd recommend you spend the $5 on this game.

One of the most intelligently designed action games I have ever played.

Gameplay mechanics and level design fit seemlessly together. New mechanics are thrown at the player every minute or two, keeping a fast and exciting pace. I have never seen so many unique enemy types in one small game.

Levels feel really alive. The ground is constantly shifting or forcing you to move and evade.

Bosses are whacky and fun. They take all that you've learned up to that point and throw in their own tricks. Truely fun bosses.

A short and sweet game that is well worth the cost of entry.

7990557.review:
From the Swedish indie developer Joakim Sandberg, comes Noitu Love 2. The digit appended to the end of the title begs the question "is there a Noitu Love 1" and yes there is. It's available as a free download on his website (http://www.konjak.org/). Noitu Love 2 is a throwback to the golden days of arcade games. Reminiscent of games like Metal Slug (sans the quarter consumption) this game is a very face paced and it won't leave you bored for a second. 

The artwork is exceptional and each level features all new environmetal art and unique enemies. There are also loads of unique minibosses (usually around two to three a level). 

Sadly there is no USB controller support for this game. It seems that the develop really had the keyboard and mouse in mind when designing this game. There doesn't seem to be any way to change the keybindings either. If you don't like the default controls then I am afraid you are out of luck.

With only seven levels the gameplay can be very short, especially considering the levels go by quickly but there are unlockables that give the game a fair bit of replayability. 

If you're looking for a gratuitous fast based action scroller then I recommend this
Score: 8/10

P.S. - When I was on the developer's website I saw that he is developing a game called "The Iconoclasts" and it looks quite good. Thought I'd give the developer a plug here by linking his video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VZE7kGax7Ds

2075723.review:
Huh. I hadn't recommended this? Well, let me recommend this.

There have been a lot of indie games jumping on the retro bandwagon, but often taking the worst elements of ancient games to heart. Noitu Love 2, though, really does feel like a lost Treasure that was somehow unearthed... in more ways than one, because it echoes the older games from Japanese developer Treasure. Unlike other games of its sort, you don't ever "power up", but instead get all the tools and moves you need from the start and can just focus on kicking butt. It's also well-animated, and the 16-bit look doesn't look lazy at any point.

It's a bit clunky in the control area - it's designed for keyboard and mouse deliberately, and there's no controller support. Though it does things you couldn't do with a controller, WASD will always feel inprecise. It's also only available at the default resolution (if you care about that sort of thing) and it's rather short, though unlockable bonus characters extend the play somewhat.

Still, I think it's one of the few games that distills the fun of old console games without being weighed down by their tropes.

5670807.review: High speed and high action, Noitu Love 2 has the pace of a Sonic game. Every level is unique and different, and the graphics are amazing while retaining their retro style. Each boss has its own special gimmick and attack patterns you need to learn to survive. It's nothing like a typical hack n' slash: it's complex and wildly varying. You can play as three vastly different characters which completely change the way the game is played, and the game is very replayable. If you've got a fast mind and fast reflexes, Noitu Love 2: Devolution is for you.

169628.review:
This game is pretty sweet!~  It is a mix between old school Megaman/Zero Style gameplay with mouse tracking for attack location and skills.

The gameplay itself is very basic.  You swing sword/shoot, but you can dash forward, double jump, shield yourself from attack, or fly accross the screen to reach a target.

Only took me an hour to finish but it would have been sooner, but the flying level I didn't understand at first. (You shoot one object and then move the mouse to another object to transfer the shot like connection nodes.)

After beating it, you unlock more charactors to beat the game with.  I think it had 7 levels with multiple bosses per level.  I can see people wanting to revisit and beat with every char if you love this kind of game.

Totally recommend for those that want a simple action game kind of like Megaman/Zero with lots of bosses.

As a side note: If you grew up on Nes, SNES, or Gen:  Start on hard mode or you will find itt too easy.

1353184.review:
This almost seems like a lost Treasure game, something in the vein of Gunstar Heroes, Guardian Heroes, Silhouette Mirage, Alien Soldier etc. Huge and creative bosses, really fast action, neat extras, beautiful pixel art... This game has everything. I can't believe it was made by just one guy (Konjak) - it's kind of awesome to see an indie developer that is really trying to make awesome games (and that has a deep respect for classic game design). It just saddens me that hacks like Jonathan Blow and Phil Fish make each only one game (the deservingly nice Braid and the holy-s***-what-a-stupid-and-ugly-game Fez) and get treated like a messiah, while Konjak consistently makes creative and beautiful works and still don't get any awards, funding or media attention from the so-called indie scene.

I want my games awesome, and Konjak makes them so. Buy this if you like creativity and challenge in your games too.

2228319.review: Yeah, I'm not entirely sure how to describe this one. I only played 19 minutes, but it's completely insane, in a good way.

2380031.review: Noitu Love 2 Devolution is a Japanese styled action platformer similar in some respects to Megaman, although significantly less oriented around jumping and much less difficult. Personally, I find the music style in these games to be atrocious, but if you are a fan of the sountrack to Street Fighter you will probably feel right at home here. The Steam Overlay is supported but widescreen is not, and most unfortunately there is no native Xbox controller support which I would consider a must for any action platform title. This type of game is not my cup of tea, but for fans of retro and particularly asian influenced games, will probably find something to like with Noitu Love 2 Devolution. In summary, this is a niche title that would probably only appeal to a very specific audience.

1613511.review:
Fast-paced run-and-gun action.

This is the most fun I have had in a long time.  The game asks very little of you in terms of time commitment; you can jump in and start pressing buttons right away without listening to expogab telling you how the game works, and the levels are all designed in such a way that you are forced to learn the game's mechanics in an organic fashion to progress.  The learning curve is pretty much perfect; this is the kind of game that makes you feel awesome for playing it.

The levels are very cleverly designed and the boss fights are tremendous fun.  The visuals remain colorful and dynamic and all-around fun to look at.  This game is all awesome all of the time.

Bon... comment dire...
Noitu Love 2, c'est super bien, tout simplement.

Pour faire un peu plus élaboré, c'est frais, original (au niveau des contrôles, puisque ce BTA se joue principalement à la souris, et ça passe super bien), peu exigeant en terme de config, joli si on aime les graphismes style "16 bits", les niveaux sont pas du tout redondants, nerveux, et la rejouabilité est très bonne.
Son seul défaut, est de ne pas être compatibles avec la plupart des outils steam (overlay, succès et tout), mais honnêtement, c'est pas très gênant.

Bref, si vous avez pas joué à ce petit monument du jeu indé sorti y'a déjà un petit moment (en 2008), c'est l'occasion de s'y mettre!

36726827.review: Very quick, very pretty, very fun, and although very short, worth every cent spent! The game has a fun, simple combat sytem that makes thrashing every bot in your way a satisfying experience. The story definitely turns up the camp-factor in a good way, offering a goofy adventure for those who want or just a fun rompventure for those who don't care as much. The pixel art is utterly amazing (all the more reason to also get excited for Konjak's new game, The Iconoclasts, which is coming out soon!) and creates a style that still stays with me as one of my favorite game aesthetics of all time.
